title: 325btc
author: 325btc
content: Who cares ?Better focus wherre to get money And btw....why eu cant be like real lion and stop playing dull if rusia dont give gas who cares ?Too much focus on this putin clown circus who rrally cares ? If putin dont give dont complain be like men not some weak go take it wherr else it is new ways always.Second point we heare on the news food crisis bla bla blaAre the cows starting to give less milk? Off course not cows are good they give same ammount of milk.Also chickens give eggs still no problem tropical banansas fruits all here no problem.Lets not focus on fake problems and one way not working you find the other way but dont complain and cry If one shop dont have food i go other one then if shops stores ply this nonsense crisis game i go dorectly to farmers i dont take a part of those dull games.Everyday we hear about putin bla bla blahhh food gas...c mon we are lions amd wolfes we dont care and dont cry about nothing.Too many people complain dont complain find ways thts itWorld is businesss if one supplier dont give you to the next one and russia is not the only one nato is so big they can invade africa and just take it for cheap in one day and news mot even gona talk about it so simpleThts so simple

Didn't get what actually want to say. You need to see you post and make correction so that it is easy to understand you point and make discussion

comments.author: Hydrogen
comments.body: Europeans could swap out gas heaters for electric ones. Energy consumption on the electrical grid would rise. And the infrastructure base could be upgraded to support the greater load. Europe's issue could be that it lacks commodities and raw materials. It has no big production or manufacturing sectors. All of which contribute to make it dependent on outside regions to provide these imports.Can NATO invade africa? America's war in the middle east costed more than $12 trillion. Can war be waged if governments lack funding to finance them. I wonder how chronic complainers would fare in a zombie apocalypse. If they were being bit by a zombie. Would they only complain about it. Or would they actually. Take steps to fix the problem. Run. Escape. Or fight back.If we see storm clouds brewing on the horizon. And know that difficult times could lie ahead. How much value does every minute, hour and day spent preparing have. Complaining may not be a good investment of time and energy. Negative returns.

comments.author: Anonylz
comments.body: What do you care what the news talks about? this is what they do, they have an obligation to give information about what is happening around the world. If you don't find it interesting am sure others don't mind. The EU can find an alternative to get gas but it doesn't stop them from talking and discussing the problem at hand which is Putin and the unending war causing many economic crises. you must think this type of situation can be fixed just by the snap of a finger.And as for cows and milk, truly I have no word for you because I do not know from where you crawl out that prevent you from seeing the inflation rate happening all over the world, nobody said cows are not producing milk but the demand for it is more than supply and that goes for other food items.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: You do realize that the Russians have what we call 'petrol' wherein a lot of industries are highly reliant to. And those eggs, milk, and other basic necessities you mentioned are produced thanks to the help of huge machines that are run by, you guess it, petrol. I understand that day by day, talks about Putin and his war on Ukraine is becoming increasingly irritating. But the mere fact that this country sits on a huge pile of oil is a matter that a lot of us can't really ignore for long. Quote from: Hydrogen on August 01, 2022, 04:55:28 PMEuropeans could swap out gas heaters for electric ones. Energy consumption on the electrical grid would rise. And the infrastructure base could be upgraded to support the greater load. Europe's issue could be that it lacks commodities and raw materials. It has no big production or manufacturing sectors. All of which contribute to make it dependent on outside regions to provide these imports.Well, Europe sans Russia is not an entirely resource-rich area. There may be some countries that have oil deposits somewhere but it dwarfs when compared to Russia. There are huge coal mines in Germany but those are no longer efficient, or no longer viable as a source of energy given how detrimental its effects are in the environment.You are right about Europe being highly-dependent on other countries for imports. Had it not been the case, I think Europe has the power to export a lot of stuff just like China. Then again, you have an economy that is built upon imports and that is doomed to fail.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: You are very naive if you think that eggs and milk can be produced enough for the global economy without the need for energy to operate the machinery that operates these industries.The world today was very happy with the export of the first shipment of grain from the Ukrainian port of Odessa towards Turkey on its way to the port of Beirut. Do you know why? Because Russia, in addition to possessing an energy weapon, also possesses a green weapon (wheat and grain), after imposing its control over Ukraine.The world has become very interconnected thanks to energy. As global demand increases, economies become more interconnected.

comments.author: Ozero
comments.body: Gas and the food problem are the pressing issues that concern many inhabitants of the planet today, since the world is now on the verge of great changes caused by climate change, the political and economic situation, including due to Russia's aggressive behavior towards other countries.Money in itself means nothing unless there are sufficient quantities of goods, products that can be exchanged for this money.Now the world is on the verge of the Third World War, and gas and food play a big role in this. It's not as simple as you imagine.

comments.author: Reid
comments.body: Something is missing on your points. It's a problem when one country is relying their gas on another country because they cannot make it. That's how trade works. Russia may also have something that they need because they cannot grow it there so they need something in exchange for their goods which is gas. Right now, the most trade will be done in currencies (money). What do they do is get the money and just buy it themselves. Now, once the supply was cut off there will be a big problem. Like mechanisms that will not work because of lack of supply. Sure, there are other options but it's not like they can adjust to it that fast. Deals will be made and since the rarity increase, other countries who supplies gas can now increase the price because of its high value. Food prices will be affected because of transportation and equipment that are running with gas.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: If all the solutions you listed was easy then Europe would have taken those steps. But these solutions are better said than done. The world is interconnected and interrelated with one nation depending an another. Natural resources are not distributed evenly, hence nation would continue to depend on another for survival.

Even US are feeling the heat and being insulted while trying to appease the Rivals. They all didn't prepare for this. The increase in food price is the ripple effect from fuel hike but the low income countries are hit more with more than 100% food inflation rate

We could be optimistic about it but it's also important that we're aware of the global issues so we could find alternative solutions on how to survive and prepare ourselves for worse scenarios. Talking about the economic problem is actually facing the reality, we can enjoy life but we should also be fully aware so we'll know what to do in case the situation would get worse in the future.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: mm2543363580 on August 01, 2022, 03:37:36 PMMilk and fruits and eggs and Putin? Didn't get what actually want to say. You need to see you post and make correction so that it is easy to understand you point and make discussion You didn't get what OP's saying because he's trying too hard to disguise his writing so as not to be mistaken for one of his alts, Polo7 being one of them (IIRC).  Not that you'd be missing much if you did understand it, because it's just silliness at its worst anyway.I'd suggest OP take a break from watching the news or whatever internet sites he's been listening to if he's tired of all the talk about the lousy economy, because that's what sucks in the eyeballs and makes them money.  If they broadcast positive news, 1) no one would believe them, and 2) no one would tune in.

comments.author: mm2543363580
comments.body: Quote from: Die_empty on August 03, 2022, 10:33:42 AMIf all the solutions you listed was easy then Europe would have taken those steps. But these solutions are better said than done. The world is interconnected and interrelated with one nation depending an another. Natural resources are not distributed evenly, hence nation would continue to depend on another for survival.  Now there is another big problem coming up - since the world is interconnected and there after-effects are long lasting. Some thing happens in one part of the world and country in the remotes corner faces it. The ripple effect lasts for a very longer period of time. Now we have another one - about Taiwan and China coming in - and US representative are already there - hola.

comments.author: bakasabo
comments.body: If you are fed up with gaz food or war news, just wait for one or two months and news vector will be change to covid again. Mark my words. These things has already been discussed, and people or world needs another threat. Covid with millions of casualties is doing it great.

Some thing happens in one part of the world and country in the remotes corner faces it. The ripple effect lasts for a very longer period of time. Now we have another one - about Taiwan and China coming in - and US representative are already there - hola.What else is new! the world is already experiencing a lot of hardship as a result of both political, social or economic problems coming up every time. so whatever is coming from china and Taiwan will only come to join the already chaotic world.And as for the @op, some of us already familiar with his 'free speech' he has a lot to say.  News outlets needs a story to tell otherwise they won't be in business, if you don't find them interesting it is a matter of changing the channel with just a click.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: It's because that gas runs almost everything in all sector. Businesses in the food industry won't run if they don't have gas, the same goes for the transport of goods and people then that's why there's an overall talk with the gas prices. Whether we admit it or not, it's like the soul of every industry where it's the main reason why the prices also goes up. If it isn't for the petrol price hike then we won't be seeing the significant effect of it to the other products and services run by petrol/oil.
